documents.document: Practice radical humility. He who masters the art of humility cannot be humiliated. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Action is the antidote to despair. - Joan Baez
When you see a good person, think of becoming like her/him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points. - Confucius
Those who love deeply never grow old; they may die of old age, but they die young. - Sir Arthur Pinero
The most fundamental tragedy of my life is that the ones who I see do not exist and the one who exists I do not see. - Kedar Joshi
We are all inclined to judge ourselves by our ideals; others, by their acts. - Harold Nicolson
A friend is one who walks in when others walk out. - Walter Winchell
She shows us only surfaces but Nature is a million fathoms deep. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Life is like riding a bicycle. You don't fall off unless you plan to stop peddling - Claude Pepper
Time has a wonderful way to show us what really matters. - Margaret Peters
To love-to fall-is not a question. To touch-to kiss-to speak-those are questions. - David Levithan
We are by nature observers, and thereby learners. That is our permanent state. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
It's not what you take when you leave this world behind you, It's what you leave behind you when you go. - Randy Travis
Things You Should Not Do to Your Hair - https://t.co/BkjtU51vDE https://t.co/wq7NTI0neY
What Your Favorite Disney Princess Says About You - https://t.co/kSjULicRq2 https://t.co/5dzFb2a816
Don't wake up one day wishing you'd tried. - Edwin McCain
Every day Look - Less is Better - https://t.co/lCk7Q3ktH7 https://t.co/qOCvRBbNeO
Live with fulfillment, serve with passion so in this lifetime you will have the ablility to die with no regrets. - Randy Gonzales
If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you. - T.S. Eliot
A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked. - Bernard meltzer
All great achievements require time. - Maya Angelou
The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams. - Oprah Winfrey
Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend. - Albert Camus
When you love someone, you say their name different. Like it's safe inside your mouth. - Jodi Picoult
There is nothing that war has ever achieved that we could not better achieve without it. - Havelock Ellis
Failure is instructive. The person who really thinks learns quite as much from his failures as from his successes. - John Dewey
You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough. - Mae West
Every blessing ignored becomes a curse. - Paulo Coelho
We never know the quality of someone else's life, though we seldom resist the temptation to assume and pass judgement. - Tami Hoag
What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others. - Confucius
If the only pray you say throughout your life is "Thank You," then that will be enough. - Elie Wiesel
Life is what you make of it. Always has been, always will be. - Grandma Moses
Our dreams are meant to come true, you know. What would be the purpose of dreaming if we could not fulfill our dreams? - Gautama Chopra
Writing is an affair of yearning for great voyages and hauling on frayed ropes. - Israel Shenker
Success is something you attract by the person you become. - Jim Rohn
I love thee, I love but thee With a love that shall not die Till the sun grows cold, And the stars grow old - Bayard Taylor
A failure is a man who has blundered but is not capable of cashing in on the experience. - Elbert Hubbard
Capacity for love in its higher forms seems to be peculiarly human although even in humans it is still peculiar. - Jeanette Winterson
Real travel would be to see the world, for even an instant, with another's eyes - Robyn Davidson
... It is better to proceed with one's duty in the service of others than wallow in the pain attachments bring - Robyn Davidson
It is not the strength of your faith but the object of your faith that actually saves you. - Timothy Keller
And in the end it is not the years in your life that count. It is the life in your years. - Abraham Lincoln
Who we are in the present includes who we were in the past. - Fred Rogers
Top Selling Singles Of All Time - https://t.co/KptUaptblx https://t.co/ptoMiNBD82
Am I the woman I think I am, the woman I want to be? More importantly, am I the woman the Savior needs me to be? - Sheri L. Dew
Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope - Maya Angelou
The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes of mind. - William James
We waste time looking for the perfect lover instead of creating the perfect love. Wouldn't that be the way to make love stay? - Tom Robbins
I know because I read...Your mind is not a cage. It's a garden. And it requires cultivating. - Libba Bray
living never wore one out so much as the effort not to live. - Anaïs Nin
Justice will not be served until those who are unaffected are as outraged as those who are. - Benjamin Franklin
Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed. - Corita Kent
If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years how man would marvel and adore. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
I've found that no matter what life throws at me, music softens the blow. - Bryce W. Anderson
Let me never fall into the vulgar mistake of dreaming that I am persecuted whenever I am contradicted. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Under Adverse conditions - some people break down,some break records - Shiv Khera
Oh, love isn't there to make us happy. I believe it exists to show us how much we can endure. - Hermann Hesse
You educate a man; you educate a man. You educate a woman; you educate a generation. - Brigham Young
if youre never scared, or embarased, or hurt, it means you never take any chances. - Julia Sorel
Ever since time began, people have recognized their true love by the light in their eyes. - Paulo Coelho
When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world. - John Muir
Hope is a thing with feathers, that perches in the soul. - Emily Dickenson
Those who wait for the right time to act on their life are doing nothing. - Santosh Kalwar
Doing nothing for others is the undoing of ourselves. - Horace Mann
Happiness is not so much in having as sharing. We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give. - Norman MacEwan
Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence. - Robert Frost
There is force in the universe, which, if we permit it, will flow through us and produce miraculous results. - Mahatma Gandhi
Those who are willing to be vulnerable move among the mysteries. - Theodore Roethke
It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped. - Anthony Robbins
Any profession of faithâ€¦entrusts the mind and heart to a truth that cannot be proven but can be lived. - Luke Timothy Johnson
Light is more important than the lantern, The poem more important than the notebook - Nizar Qabbani
For which of my bad parts didst thou first fall in love with me? - William Shakespeare
Being defeated is often a temporary condition. Giving up is what makes it permanent. - Marilyn Vos Savant
Service is the rent we pay for being. It is the very purpose of life, and not something you do in your spare time. - Marian Wright Edelman
Everything will turn out right, the world is built on that. - Mikhail Bulgakov
Waiting hurts. Forgetting hurts. But not knowing which decision to take is the worst of suffering. - Paulo Coelho
You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something sometime in your life. - Winston Churchill
one simple act of kindness may mean the world to someone else - Allison Levine
To live fully, we must learn to use things and love people, and not love things and use people. - John Powell
It is not the absence of defensiveness that characterizes learning teams but the way defensiveness is faced - Peter M. Senge
There are two kinds of failures: those who thought and never did, and those who did and never thought. - Laurence J. Peter
A work of art has no importance whatever to society. It is only important to the individual. - Vladimir Nabokov
There is in writing the constant joy of sudden discovery, of happy accident. - H.L. Mencken
People are going to say what they want to say and think what they want to think, and I can't change their minds. - Hilary Duff
The love of liberty is the love of others; the love of power is the love of ourselves. - William Hazlitt
There's always room for love; You just have to move a few things around. - Anoymous
It's a sad day when you find out that it's not accident or time or fortune, but just yourself that kept things from you. - Hellman, Lillian
Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be. - Bob Dylan
There's an old saying that applies to me: you can't lose a game if you don't play the game. - William Shakespeare
For the world is in a bad state, but everything will become still worse unless each of us does his best. - Viktor E. Frankl
The reason birds can fly and we can't is simply because they have perfect faith, for to have faith is to have wings. - J.M. Barrie
The best things in life aren't things. - Art Buchwald
Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air. - John Quincy Adams
The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in. - Mitch Albom
We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures. - Thornton Wilder
Man is a being in search of meaning. - Plato
Each person must live their life as a model for others. - Rosa Parks
First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win. - Mahatma Gandhi
A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her. - Max Lucado
Life is one fool thing after another whereas love is two fool things after each other. - Oscar Wilde
